dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Wildberries has taken the top spot again in Kazakhstan's TOP KZ Retail E-Commerce ranking for 2021.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: He mentioned they have over 5 million users just in Kazakhstan, which is, like, a massive chunk of the market.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they offer, what was it, over 500,000 products? That's an enormous catalog.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We now offer more than 1 million products and our team is continually developing new innovative e-commerce services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But it's interesting—their GMV last year was $500 million, and that was only slightly ahead of Kaspi.kz.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's interesting-their G M V last year was five hundred dollars million, and that was only slightly ahead of the website.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh wow, so the competition is really tight. I wonder how the rankings are even put together.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh wow, so the competition is really tight. I wonder how the rankings are even put together.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The Kazakhstani Chamber of Commerce and KPMG are part of the consortium that compiles it, based on online sales data.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Kazakhstani Chamber of Commerce and K P M G are part of the consortium that compiles it, based on online sales data.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The TOP KZ Retail E-Commerce ranking is compiled annually by Forbes Kazakhstan in conjunction with consulting company Baker Tilly Kazakhstan and based upon online sales.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But then there was that other study, right? By the Eurasian Economic Commission and Deloitte?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then there was that other study, right? By the Eurasian Economic Commission and Deloitte?

dialogue_turns.tts_text: Down to three hundred billion tenge-that's a significant drop. And consumers are moving away from marketplaces to direct brand sites.

At the same time, buyers are clearly opting for marketplaces, that enable them to purchase goods from a wide range of merchants.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which creates problems for big companies—fewer sales channels, smaller reach, higher ad costs…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which creates problems for big companies-fewer sales channels, smaller reach, higher ad costs...

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So even though Wildberries is on top, the overall trend is shifting underneath them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So even though Wildberries is on top, the overall trend is shifting underneath them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It makes you wonder how they plan to keep innovating with those headwinds.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It makes you wonder how they plan to keep innovating with those headwinds.

artist_script:
On the floor of the Almaty Chamber of Commerce, the annual e-commerce rankings are in.
HostA: Wildberries has taken the top spot again in Kazakhstan's TOP KZ Retail E-Commerce ranking for 2021.
HostB: Yeah, for the second year running, right? That's a huge deal. And their CEO, uh, Ivan Petrov, he put out a statement thanking customers.
HostA: He mentioned they have over 5 million users just in Kazakhstan, which is, like, a massive chunk of the market.
HostB: And they offer, what was it, over 500,000 products? That's an enormous catalog.
HostA: But it’s interesting—their GMV last year was $500 million, and that was only slightly ahead of Kaspi.kz.
HostB: Oh wow, so the competition is really tight. I wonder how the rankings are even put together.
HostA: The Kazakhstani Chamber of Commerce and KPMG are part of the consortium that compiles it, based on online sales data.
HostB: But then there was that other study, right? By the Eurasian Economic Commission and Deloitte?
HostA: Yeah, they found that Kazakhstan’s whole e-commerce market actually shrank by 10% in the first half of 2021.
HostB: Down to 300 billion tenge—that’s a significant drop. And consumers are moving away from marketplaces to direct brand sites.
HostA: Which creates problems for big companies—fewer sales channels, smaller reach, higher ad costs…
HostB: So even though Wildberries is on top, the overall trend is shifting underneath them.
HostA: Exactly. It makes you wonder how they plan to keep innovating with those headwinds.
